question: What is an operon?
ideal_answer: An operon is a group of genes linked together in a linear fashion and producing polycistronic mRNA.

s. An operon is a group of genes linked together in a linear fashion and producing a polycistronic mRNA. Trans-acting factors regulate the transcription of these genes by interacting with promoter/regulatory sequences in the 5'-flanking region of the most 5'-ward of the genes.
